lines.text: Ben, what a swell lookin' dump this is.
Well, what did you expect to find? Coney Island? Come on, let's promote a drink.
Let's promote two.
It's morning, Ben.
I, another day in the funny old game of life.
Sometimes I wonder why we trouble to play it at all.

[Looking at a sleeping Bingo]
She's lovely. Fascinating.
the sweetest flows glow in the mud.
You know, eight months is a pretty long time to be together. And I don't mind tellin' you, my partner's beginning to get a little bit daffy about her.
Tell me, have you ever heard her swear?
Well, yes, a little.
No, she doesn't swear a little. If you've heard her at all, you've heard everything!
Too bad there's so much daylight out here, I almost kissed you just then.
It will be quite gloomy out here, after dinner.
I know, but, it will be so dark then, I won't be able to see your eyes. I love your eyes.
Oh, you *do* know how to flirt, don't you.
Well, I learned about women from, eh, women.
That was awfully nice for you to do that for me.
That's alright. I liked it!
Why you whippersnapper, she's got millions in her own right!
You impudent young pup!
From South America to New York... from calico to chiffon... from jungle to night-club... and all in a few months.
Give us a little kiss, Bingo. Oh, baby, I - I'm so proud of you!
The night is young and so is the gin. Come on!
Drink one of these and they'll be picking you off the ceiling with a butterfly net.
How's Miss Alice?
Oh, my, wait until you see her. She's simply beautiful.
Is she tame yet?
Tame? Oh, no. I sometimes think she's worst. Of course, you know she's learned a lot of that highfalutin stuff. You know the bunk. But, underneath it all, she's still the same sweet Bingo.
It was awfully nice of you to ask me.
That's all right Andy. I'm happy to have you.
What's going on here? What's the matter?
One man told another man he could lick my man but he couldn't do it, Uncle Ben, no sir, he couldn't do it!
Oh, Bingo, darling, you must be dog tired. Come along, skip off to bed, now.
In a nasty way?
Nasty? How nasty?
Where's Bingo?
How should I know?
I never did see what that dame had anything on me, outside of the coin.
Oh, Andy, you're drunk, darling. You don''t know what you're saying. You're outta your mind.

You know, young McAllister was spinnin' the gun to show me how Tom Mix did it. And I took it away from him, because I wanted to show him I knew how to spin a gun long before I ever heard of Tom Mix and suddenly, bang, off it goes.
I'm sorry, dear. It was very foolish of me.
Don't darling, please. Because, you know, I might have killed you.
Didn't you want to?
Yes. When I thought you where going with another girl, I did.
I'm just an old jungle rat.
What the dickens is your name, anyway?
Bingo. Bingo Dowling.
Bingo?
Well, my right name is Alice. You see, a sailor named me.
A sailor?

Mm-hmm. It was, em, you see, I was walkin' down the street once and a sailor made a wise crack at me, so I socked him in the nose. And when he came to he said "Bingo!" The natives said it and it sort of stuck.
